definition: He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
surname He
to congratulate
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long

sentences.english: He Long's health had deteriorated while he was in prison. ;
sentences.chinese: 賀龍在獄中時健康已經越來越惡化了。

sentences.english: It is said that Saturday night in the stadium has he long a Jacky cheung's concert .
sentences.chinese: 據說週六晚上在賀龍體育館有一場張學友的演唱會。

definition: Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong

Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
